templates.content: We highly recommend using it only in face-to-face and carrying positions. It's super comfy and safe that way! However, we kindly advise against using it for side-carrying on your hip. We want to make sure you and your little one are always in the best and most comfortable positions.

templates.content: Yes, the Snug actually helps take even more weight off your body because the design helps support and distribute the weight across your torso.

templates.content: Attaching the Snug to your Tushbaby Hipseat Carrier converts it into a hands-free soft carrier that can be used for children up to 3 years old. The Snug is not suitable for newborns, but can be used in the face-to-face position once your infant reaches 12 lbs. Remember that baby must sit face-to-face until they can hold their head upright.
templates.name: Are the Snug and TushBaby suitable for all ages up to 3 years similar to the  standalone TushBaby hipset carrier?

templates.content: We understand that not every product works for every baby. If you find that the Tushbaby isn't a good fit for you and your little one, you can return it within 30 days of purchase. Please note that it must be in new condition with all original packaging and with tags attached. You can start your return here: https://tushbaby.com/pages/returns

templates.content: Tushbaby evenly distributes your baby's weight, so you don't have to constantly switch sides or strain your back as you carry them. Approved by both pediatricians for babies and orthopedists and physical therapists for adults, the supportive ergonomic seat puts your baby's hips in the pediatric-recommended "M" position and reduces painful spine curvature for caregivers.
templates.name: Do I have to keep switching sides so I don't strain my back (Tushbaby Hip Carrier)?

templates.content: Great question! The Tushbaby waistband is 46 inches long, but you lose a few inches where the two waistbands overlap to secure the Velcro. We recommend Tushbaby for those with a 43-inch waist or smaller. Our extension belt adds an extra 23 inches to the waistband, so you can adjust it up or down to fit you just right if you need some extra length.
templates.name: Would you recommend an extender?

templates.content: The Tushbaby hip carrier has its own waistband that the seat is part of. We have a waistband extender that provides additional length and can attach to the Tushbaby's waistband - https://tushbaby.com/products/tushbaby-extension-belt We currently don't have any straps other than the waistband extender, to extend the length of the Tushbaby.

We are owned and operated by three moms from California who believe you get what you pay for, and that you and your baby deserve only the best!

templates.content: A hip seat is kinda like fanny pack (also known as a bum bag), but way better. Here's why. A hip seat is a simple baby carrier that wraps around your waist and sits above your hips to help you carry your baby more comfortably, and with less hassle. There's a secure shelf-like seat where your baby sits, while you hold them with an arm. This seat is designed to put your baby's hips in the recommended M-shaped position while taking the strain off of your back, arms, and hips. It's also designed to store items like diapers, wipes, and other essentials inside.
templates.name: What is a hip seat?

It also carries all your things in the 5 storage pockets!

templates.content:
That would depend on the material! Sabe and Velvet Silver are machine-washable. Grey, regular black, chambray, black and gold, leopard, blue stripe, and charcoal are made of polyester and are machine washable.

Cognac, cream, vegan black, and sand are made of vegan leather and should not be machine washed, please wipe them down only.

Wash instructions are also in your user manual or here: https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0060/9982/8802/files/Tushbaby_manual_QR_2023.pdf?v=1678737686 And on our instructional page as well: https://tushbaby.com/pages/instructional-videos

templates.content: The Tushbaby Hipseat's waistband and strap can be adjusted to fit snugly around the caregiver's natural waist, while the Snug's side straps can be fine-tuned for a tight fit across the baby. The shoulder straps can also be moved for optimal comfort, and any extra webbing can be neatly rolled up and secured in elastic loops.

templates.content: The Snug Attachment offers two positions to carry your child hands-free up to 36 months old. Children weighing between 12-45lbs can be comfortably positioned in the face-to-face position, while those weighing 16-45lbs can see the world in the front-facing position.

templates.content: To clean your Snug, simply machine wash cold on delicate cycle and lay flat to dry.
